bug.author: sepandhaghighi
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h4>Description</denchmark-h>
Vulture finds unused code in Python programs. This is useful for cleaning up and finding errors in large code bases. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jendrikseipp/vulture>Repo Link</denchmark-link>
Vulture call in is wrong. <denchmark-h:h4>Expected Behavior</denchmark-h>
Find unused code <denchmark-h:h4>Actual Behavior</denchmark-h>
Nothing <denchmark-h:h4>Operating System</denchmark-h>
Windows 10 <denchmark-h:h4>Python Version</denchmark-h>
Python 3.6 <denchmark-h:h4>PyCM Version</denchmark-h>
PyCM 2.3

comments.comment:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sadrasabouri>@sadrasabouri</denchmark-link>
Hi As a warm-up task, please fix this issue. You should edit vulture section in to work for , folders and , and set minimum confidence to 65%. Notice 1 : You can verify your edits by lower minimum confidence. Notice 2 : Before start, take a look at <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sepandhaghighi/pycm/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md>Contributing Guidelines</denchmark-link>
